title: Projects
text: Here are some of the data science and statistical analysis projects I’ve worked on. These projects cover a range of topics, including machine learning, experimental design, and predictive modeling. Click on each project to explore the details and download the full reports.

title: Projects
text:
Skills Used in These Projects

Programming & Tools: Python, R, Tableau, Seaborn, ggplot2

Machine Learning: Logistic Regression, Random Forest, XGBoost, Ridge Regression, QDA

Data Processing: Feature Engineering, One-Hot Encoding, Data Cleaning, Cross-Validation

Statistical Analysis: ANOVA, Hypothesis Testing, Classification, Regression

Experimental Design: Randomized Block Design, Pretest-Posttest Design

title: Does Heavy or Classical Music Impact Reading Comprehension: An ANOVA Analysis
text: This study examines how classical and heavy metal music influence reading comprehension. Using an ANOVA analysis within a Randomized Block Design (RCBD), we tested whether music genre affects performance on a standardized reading test.

title: Does Heavy or Classical Music Impact Reading Comprehension: An ANOVA Analysis
text: This study examines how classical and heavy metal music influence reading comprehension. Using an ANOVA analysis within a Randomized Block Design (RCBD), we tested whether music genre affects performance on a standardized reading test.

title: Does Heavy or Classical Music Impact Reading Comprehension: An ANOVA Analysis
text:
Methodology

Participants: 60 participants randomly assigned to classical or heavy metal conditions

Design: Pretest-Posttest with Randomized Block Design (RCBD)

Analysis: ANOVA to compare reading scores across conditions

title: Does Heavy or Classical Music Impact Reading Comprehension: An ANOVA Analysis
text:
Key Findings

Classical music group scored significantly higher on reading comprehension.

Heavy metal music had a small negative effect, but not statistically significant.

RCBD controlled for prior reading ability, improving statistical power.

title: Does Heavy or Classical Music Impact Reading Comprehension: An ANOVA Analysis
text:
Results Visualization

Figure: Mean reading scores by music type

title: Does Heavy or Classical Music Impact Reading Comprehension: An ANOVA Analysis
text:
Conclusion
Our findings suggest that classical music may enhance reading comprehension, while heavy metal has no strong negative effect. Future research could explore music tempo, lyrics, or individual differences.
Download the full report (PDF)

title: Diversity in Depression: Analyzing Mental Health Disparities
text: This study investigates how demographic, socioeconomic, and psychological factors contribute to depression risk in the United States. Using logistic regression and random forest models, we analyze data from the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) to uncover key predictors of depression.

title: Diversity in Depression: Analyzing Mental Health Disparities
text: This study investigates how demographic, socioeconomic, and psychological factors contribute to depression risk in the United States. Using logistic regression and random forest models, we analyze data from the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) to uncover key predictors of depression.

title: Diversity in Depression: Analyzing Mental Health Disparities
text:
Methodology

Dataset: 2023 National Health Interview Survey (NHIS)
Sample Size: 28,260 U.S. adults
Predictors Explored: Race, education, income-to-poverty ratio, anxiety screening, disability, and discrimination experiences.
Statistical Methods:

Logistic Regression (to estimate depression risk)
Random Forest (to assess variable importance)
Chi-Squared Tests (to examine categorical associations)
K-Fold Cross Validation (to validate model performance)

title: Diversity in Depression: Analyzing Mental Health Disparities
text:
Key Findings

Anxiety screening was the strongest predictor of depression risk.
Disability status significantly increased the odds of depression.
Experiences of discrimination, such as feeling disrespected or threatened, had a strong association with depression.
Lower socioeconomic status (income-to-poverty ratio) was linked to higher depression risk.

title: Diversity in Depression: Analyzing Mental Health Disparities
text:
Results Visualization



Feature Importance

title: Diversity in Depression: Analyzing Mental Health Disparities
text:
Conclusion
Our findings indicate that mental health disparities are influenced by economic, psychological, and social factors. Policies aimed at improving financial stability, reducing discrimination, and expanding mental health care access could mitigate depression risk.
View the full report (PDF)

title: Predicting NBA Outcomes Using Machine Learning Methods
text: This project predicts NBA game outcomes using Logistic Regression with L2 regularization (Ridge penalty). The model analyzes team and player statistics to determine the probability of a win or loss.

title: Predicting NBA Outcomes Using Machine Learning Methods
text: This project predicts NBA game outcomes using Logistic Regression with L2 regularization (Ridge penalty). The model analyzes team and player statistics to determine the probability of a win or loss.

title: Predicting NBA Outcomes Using Machine Learning Methods
text:
Methodology

Dataset: Historical NBA game data with team stats (shooting %, turnovers, rebounds, assists, etc.)

Feature Engineering: Scaled continuous variables and selected the most important predictors

Modeling: Implemented Logistic Regression with L2 penalty (Ridge Regularization) for better generalization

Evaluation: Measured accuracy, precision, recall, and AUC to assess performance

title: Predicting NBA Outcomes Using Machine Learning Methods
text:
Key Findings

Logistic Regression with L2 regularization outperformed other models

Turnovers, shooting %, and rebounds were the strongest predictors

Regularization reduced overfitting, improving model stability

title: Predicting NBA Outcomes Using Machine Learning Methods
text:
Results Visualization

Figure: Key features influencing NBA game outcomes

title: Predicting NBA Outcomes Using Machine Learning Methods
text:
Conclusion
L2-penalized Logistic Regression provides a stable and interpretable model for predicting NBA game outcomes. Future work could explore player-specific metrics, momentum analysis, and real-time in-game factors.
Download the full report (PDF)

title: Rory Freck
text:
Hey, I’m Rory Freck, and I’m passionate about the intersection of finance, data, and problem-solving. I’m currently finishing up my degree in Statistics and Data Science at UCLA, where I’ve spent the last few years studying statistical theory, data applications, and machine learning. This fall, I’ll be starting my Master of Professional Accountancy (MPAcc) at CSUN where I will hope to start my career in public auditing.
I’ve had the chance to work as a Data Analyst Intern at Stanford, where I built interactive dashboards in Tableau, analyzed hiring trends, and created an employee recognition webpage using Drupal and HTML/CSS. Before that, I interned at Stony Apparel Corp., where I helped with data integrity, client orders, and data verification; ultimately, leading to the prevention of a $5,000 compliance fee through careful verification.
Outside of work and school, I enjoy playing golf and talking baseball. I am always looking to learn, connect, and develop professionally, so feel free to connect on LinkedIn!
